Author: z0n0
Title: [ANN] FundRequest : Platform for rewarding open source contributions
Body: April 24th, 2018 - Development Update  Two weeks ago we communicated that our contracts were finalised and ready to be audited, but after a quick internal discussion weâ€™ve decided to add a few extra changes before deploying our contracts to mainnet. One of which is the upgrade to Solidity version 0.4.23. The main reason we decided to immediately go to 0.4.23 is because it supports accessing dynamic data (such as strings) returned by function calls. Basically, this means that we could use the Eternal Storage pattern in our repository contracts.  What does this all mean exactly? It means that by upgrading to the latest solidity version, we are able to write our data to Eternal Storage and in doing so, separating our data from our logic. In turn making upgrades to existing contracts a lot easier for our developers and transparent to the end-users. Key points we worked on: Features:     Upgrade to Solidity version 0.4.23 (pull request #37).     Improve the upgradability of the smart contracts (pull request #38).     Implement a page where all the details of a request are visible (pull request #106).     Implement a page where you can browse all the request that are relevant to a certain user (pull request #92, #93).     Upgrade profile to match the structure of userprofile (pull request #105).     Refactor pieces of code to keep it maintainable, by making a separate functionality class from Callable (issue #30).     Finalised designing front-end screens using Sketch.  Bugfixes:     Pending request removed but not added to â€˜myâ€™ list (pull request #99).     Refactor filter for list (pull request #93).     CSS not loading properly after registering on the platform (issue #79).

Author: z0n0
Title: [ANN] FundRequest : Platform for rewarding open source contributions
Body: Development update  Last week our auditing firm, Least Authority, finished the audit of our vesting wallets after which we added the vested tokens in the overview. Those that have invested in the presale can view their vested tokens here. We also started to add controls to the automatic claiming process which will allow us to enable claiming automatically..  Progress in bulletpoints:      Enabling of automatic claiming based on organisation has been added in the backend. (commit)     Limit ERC20 tokens based on organisation support added to smart contracts. (branch)     Improve AzraÃ«l to handle automatic claims from a queue. (commit)     Continue to update the front-end based on the profile design. (branch)     Made small changes to the main website (#20, #23, #21, #26)     Addressed two issues that were raised during the audit of the vesting contracts. For more info please read the security audit report #2.     Deployed vesting contracts and enhanced balance.fundrequest.io to show vested tokens (#24).

Our goal is to reach mass adoption, hence no fees, and in a 2nd stage add premium features for intensive users. Similar approach of what Linkedin did.  An example of a premium feature is to get notified first on high value requests,...

Author: Pivooooo
Title: [ANN] FundRequest : Platform for rewarding open source contributions
Body: One of the milestones we've included in our roadmap is the development of a Chrome browser add-on so that you can fund issues on your favorite platform. Why did you choose Chrome?

Author: FundRequest
Title: [ANN] FundRequest : Platform for rewarding open source contributions
Body: We will use the MetaMask plugin to fund an issue and Metamask only runs in Chrome. Hence the choice.  We will also create plugins for other browsers in a later stage. We might fund their development using the FundRequest platform ;-)

Author: FundRequest
Title: [ANN] FundRequest : Platform for rewarding open source contributions
Body: We've noticed that we are getting more traction.  The latest news is communicated via our telegram channel (https://t.me/fundrequestofficial) , our blog.fundrequest.io and via our newsletter. Our next project update is planned for next week. At the moment we have 7 partnerships lined up , the first was announced +/- 2 weeks ago, that was Request Network. Some will be communicated before the token sale, others shortly after. In parallel we are in contact with high open source profiles to extend our advisory board. For more detail you will need to join us on telegram or follow our other media channels

Author: FundRequest
Title: [ANN] FundRequest : Platform for rewarding open source contributions
Body: One of the main investors is 1kx capital (some info on what they do : https://www.crowdfundinsider.com/2017/12/126194-40-million-private-placement-ico-aelf-raises-55k-ether-private-token-sale/) But most of the funds we were able to collect from a bunch of smaller investors, a real community effort. And from looking at the way our whitelist is growing it appears that we will again have to set a low individual cap to make sure everyone has a chance to take part.

Author: FundRequest
Title: [ANN] FundRequest : Platform for rewarding open source contributions
Body: That is one of our long term goals of our project.  Let me share just one of our visions. The basic flow is one person funds one issue and one person resolves it. After that multiple people can fund (introducing crowdfunding). Next multiple people can resolve an issue (introducing the team concept). If you can resolve one issue, one can resolve multiple, if we start grouping issues, then we can start funding projects and teams can apply for projects. So why would it not be possible to create an international development factory? If we are able to develop a project, why only start at the development layer, why not start one step before, with the analysis. Give those people/profiles also a marketplace (doesn't exist at the moment). At that moment we are not far from a platform where a person with a good idea and funding can go come to fundrequest to have it build from A to Z.  Today we focus on the first step.

Author: FundRequest
Title: [ANN] FundRequest : Platform for rewarding open source contributions
Body: https://alpha.fundrequest.io  (code is located here : https://github.com/fundrequest/)

Author: FundRequest
Title: [ANN] FundRequest : Platform for rewarding open source contributions
Body: For the people that are interested we also have a bounty campaign (will close in 2 weeks)  Link to the BitcoinTalk thread https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2668800.0

Author: FundRequest
Title: [ANN] FundRequest : Platform for rewarding open source contributions
Body: We had a few interesting questions on telegram  that we want to share with you  How do you compare with Bounty0x and Gitcoin? How we differ from our competition in pure product : We will support multiple platforms, crowdfunding of issues and team collaboration. Additionally we will create a reputation system based on skill , that will allow you to generate reputation cross platform. For example you can get reputation from fixing a python bug on GitHub but also for providing the best answer to a python question on StackExchange. We are aware that the most challenging part is to get the entreprises onboard and are therefor already out in the field pitching our project and collecting feedback so we can make the right pivote where needed to align ourself with their needs.  We are aware of our strenghts but also of our weaknesses , therefore we try to surround us with the right people to strenghten us where we are weak (for example marketing, networking)   If I create a bounty to fix a bug how do you make sure that the ones taking the task are qualified enough? ðŸ¤” We rely on the host platform (e.g GitHub, ...). The project maintainer is the person that will accept the solution, bad quality will be filtered out. The more people that will use our platform the more solutions that will be provided for the maintainer to pick from. Similar to platforms like 99designs.com And if malicious behaviour occurs anyone can raise a disput   Yes but letâ€™s say task would take 1 week to finish I would have wasted 1 week ðŸ¤” You can ask yourself the question how is this quality guaranteed today? (without the financial incentive). We start with that as a base, and we add a reputation system (including penalties) People will be able to stake tokens for working on a request, this will show devs + maintainer how many people are working on an issue   Letâ€™s say I have a smart contract to audit I want to make sure I have a pro doing it ðŸ¤”. If a friend got kidnapped I would hire some ex special ops vs crowdsource rescue team no? ðŸ¤” That will be a pro feature, if you are a customer that want specific people to work on it, people with a higher skill/reputation in a certain field, you will be able to configure that in your request, but the price of the request will be higher. The skill token/reputation system can be compared with the reputation on StackExchange. We plan to integrate is cross platform, allow users to get "java skills" from answering a question on stackexchange, but also on fixing a java bug on Github   As the platform gains more interest and devs yes but how do you solve the chicken egg problem at start? ðŸ¤” Wwe have tokens reserved in our incentivization pool, so we can do the initial funding to attract and reward developers, and in the 2nd stage enterprises will take over   If am an enterprise I have my own devs why would I want to use your platform? That depends if you want to work with/on open source software. But the feedback we got from a VP from Samsung was the following and I quote " Today you can not build a product without using open source". As an example, Samsung has developers, but they do not have enough people to support 900+ open source components that they use in their products. In comes FundRequest.  Many enterprise use OSS code but donâ€™t contribute ðŸ™„ True , but here is a list of companies that support the Linux Foundation (more then3000). Just look at the Premium, gold and silver members (more the 200) . All are potential clients https://www.linuxfoundation.org/membership/members/   Can your platform also work for non dev tasks? Yes, at it's core it is about a request and a valid solution. We start with code, since we know that world best. The reason why we also want to include StackExchange is because it allows us not only to be less depended on one platform (e.g. GitHub), but also it allows us to switch markets. Just have a look at all the sub sections they have : https://stackexchange.com/sites Some examples : Mathematics, Music: Practice & Theory, Languages, Finance & Money,...  How will you monetize? A commission per task? We will not take any fees, we will first focus on mass adaptation. Afterwards we will offer premium features to monetize our platform. Features could be : Ads, job offers, early notifications, ...

Author: FundRequest
Title: [ANN] FundRequest : Platform for rewarding open source contributions
Body: We will try to release a beta or a more stable version of the alpha before the ICO, but since that is already the 20th of November we are not sure if we will make it. Especially due to the overhead an ICO brings in terms of providing formation, going to conferences, setting up the forms and channels to deal with the crowdsale.  A head up , we are not going to allow everyone to partake, you will have to be whitelisted. The first step will be to join our slack community

Author: FundRequest
Title: [ANN] FundRequest : Platform for rewarding open source contributions
Body: FundRequest : Decentralized Marketplace for Open Source Collaboration  Website :: WhitePaper :: GitHub repository   What is FundRequest?  FundRequest introduces an easy and secure way to reward bugfixes and feature requests on any project. More than a monetization platform, FundRequest is a system for custom support that will boost the Open Source community as a whole â€“ from developer to end user.  It allows developers to search for funded issues that best match their skill set to solve and claim the bounty. Developers will receive SkillTokens in addition to their bounty what will validate their skills on different technologies. By their SkillTokens developers will be able to see their ranking on multiple leader boards.  FundRequest provides value to Users Developers Business Software Projects  FundRequest can be used to Accelerate development Reward contributors Measure community interest Support communities Custom assistance Trust & Security   We invite you to please read our WhitePaper to get to know the nitty gritty.    Watch the introduction video on YouTube  or  Try out our early Alpha release 0.1.6    Be part of our Community!  Feel free to join our growing community, to track our progress, help develop, support us in any way or if you just have a few questions, weâ€™ll be happy to discuss!  Telegram :: Twitter :: Rocket Chat :: Reddit     Participate in the token sale  The token sale will be planned in Q2 2018. The max cap is set at 15M USD at a rate of 1800 FND for 1 ETH.  Registration is required to participate in the token sale.   Feel free to have a look at the code in our public GitHub repository  Read the WhitePaper !    FundRequest : Decentralized Marketplace for Open Source Collaboration  Website :: WhitePaper :: GitHub repository
